name: Saurian Indwelling and Mimesis
desc: A Natlanese mechanism for both exploration and combat that allows the player to take the form of Saurians and their abilities.

customize.text:
Saurian Indwelling is a game mechanism introduced in <color=#ece5d8>Natlan</color> . With the use of <color=#ffe14b>Spiritsconces</color> or adult Saurians found in the wild, players can Indwell into that specific Saurian and assume their abilities. During the <color=#ffe14b>Indwelt state</color> , Normal Attack, Elemental Skill, and Elemental Burst are replaced with the Saurian's abilities.
This mechanism is not region-specific thus any character can be used for Indwelling.
Players can Indwell into 6 types of Saurians introduced in <color=#ece5d8>Natlan</color> .

<color=#ffffff>Saurian</color>
<color=#ffffff>Details</color>
<color=#ffffff>Tepetlisaurus</color>

customize.name: Tepetlisaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with a drill-like horn and strong claws that can tunnel through rocks and solid phlogiston.
According to legend, the ancestor of all Tepetlisaurs was a massive drake as large as a mountain, with an exceptionally long lifespan. When it slept, mountains would form along its back, and when it woke, it would shake off the dirt and rocks, leaving behind gems and jade shining amongst its scales. The huge, drill-shaped objects in the Children of Echoes are said to be the remains of that great drake's large drill-horn.

customize.text: Tepetilisaurs are the tribal companions of

customize.name: Children of Echoes
customize.desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Nanatzcayan. The tribe's people are famous for mining and live alongside the Tepetlisaurs.

customize.text: They have the ability to drill into the ground and move freely, climb <color=#ffe14b>Solid Phlogiston</color> and are highly sensitive to buried treasures.
<color=#ffffff>Koholasaurus</color>

customize.name: Koholasaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with thick, strong flippers and a long tail that can swim in water and liquid phlogiston.
According to legend, more ancient dragons were even more able to adapt to their environments, and when the largest dragon in the ocean of the age floated on the surface, it could even be mistaken for an island. It is said that today's Koholasaurus are the descendants of that great sea dragon, and in their broad backs the colossal forms of those ancient sea beasts may yet be glimpsed.

customize.text: Koholasaurs are the tribal companions of

customize.name: People of the Springs
customize.desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Meztli. They are cheerful, kind people, lovers of music, gatherings, and hot springs. The tribe lives alongside the Koholasaurs.

customize.text: They have the ability to swim on water, <color=#ffe14b>Liquid Phlogiston,</color> and use <color=#ffe14b>Spiritways</color> freely.
<color=#ffffff>Yumkasaurus</color>

customize.name: Yumkasaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with powerful hind legs and a fluffy tail, capable of spitting Flamegranate pectin hidden in their cheek pouches out, wrapping around distant objects.
According to legend, the original Yumkasaurs were not at all like today, but much smaller, so small that they were difficult even to see. They could roam freely with the wind, cling to the bodies of the massive dragons, or gather in groups to move about like clouds. However, in order to maintain their form after their abilities degenerated, they had no choice but to assume their current shape.

customize.text: Yumkasaurs are the tribal companions of

customize.name: Scions of the Canopy
customize.desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Huitztlan. The tribe's people love extreme sports like rock climbing, rappelling, and volcano parkour and live alongside the Yumkasaurs.

customize.text: They have the ability to use their tongues to move in air freely, grab items, and use <color=#ffe14b>Flamegranates</color> with their pectins.
<color=#ffffff>Qucusaurus</color>

customize.name: Qucusaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with large, supple wings that can glide through the air for long periods.
It is said that the ancestors of the Qucusaurs were the closest in form to the mighty winged dragons, and that they could soar through the sky like clouds. According to the storytellers, when the greatest of such dragons spread its wings, the entire sky would be blotted out. Of course, the Qucusaurs we see today no longer possess such forms, but the claws they hide within their downy feather coats remain as sharp as ever.

customize.text: Qucusaurs are the tribal companions of

customize.name: Flower-Feather Clan
customize.desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Tlalocan. The tribe's people live alongside the Qucusaurs.

customize.text: They have the ability to glide through the air for long periods and ascend with <color=#ffe14b>Gaseous Phlogiston</color> .
<color=#ffffff>Iktomisaurus</color>

customize.name: Iktomisaurus
customize.desc:
Able to use their plumage for leaping, Iktomisaurs are also the only type of Saurian to have grasped how to enter the "Spiritspeaker" state.
According to legend, their ancestors did not have a physical form, and instead could drift like spirits between reality and the spiritual realm, manifesting themselves through the darkness of night. Some also say that the first Iktomisaur to emerge from the Night Kingdom was not actually a true Saurian, but rather a unique race distinct from ordinary Saurians.

customize.text: Iktomisaurs are the tribal companions of

customize.name: Masters of the Night-Wind
customize.desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Mictlan. They are famous for their predictions and rituals to amplify the ability to communicate with the Night Kingdom and the Wayob.

customize.text: They have the ability to perform high leaps, enter "Spiritspeaker" state, and scan <color=#ffe14b>Nightspirit Graffiti</color> .
<color=#ffffff>Tatankasaurus</color>

customize.name: Tatankasaurus
customize.desc:
A saurian with a hard, bony crest and a powerful body suited to dashing around volcanic landscapes.
According to legend, the Tatankasaurus's ancestors were so large they could use their horns to move mountains, but they lacked the agility of their smaller, modern relatives. Perhaps the great power that Tatankasaurs still possess is a gift passed down through their bloodline.

customize.text: Tatankasaurs are the tribal companions of

customize.name: Collective of Plenty
customize.desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Teteocan. The tribe's people live alongside the Tatankasaurs.

customize.text: They have the ability to perform a Quick Charge, and enter the Spirited state to push heavy objects, break through <color=#ffe14b>Pulverite</color> , make flying leaps using terrain, and even briefly dash across water or liquid Phlogiston.
Indwelling into a Saurian

There are two ways to Indwell to a Saurian:
1. Find a <color=#ffe14b>Spiritsconce</color>
2. Find an adult Saurian
<color=#ffffff>Spiritsconce</color>

<color=#ffe14b>Spiritsconces</color> can be found throughout <color=#ece5d8>Natlan</color> . It will also spawn a Spiritsconce when a wild adult Saurian is defeated in battle. After it is used for Indwelling, it will respawn in 15 seconds.
<color=#ffffff>Adult Saurian</color>
Wild adult Saurians can be found in the wild or certain quest domains. After a defeat in battle, it will respawn alive after 1 minute.
Indwelt State

The Indwelling activation has a cooldown of 4 seconds and unlimited duration. However, when Phlogiston runs out, the Saurian will be unable to perform its abilities until it is recovered.
Each Saurian has its own HP bar during the <color=#ffe14b>Indwelt State</color> . This HP can be lost during battle or from Fall Damage. When the Saurian is defeated in battle or other natural means such as drowning, the player will be ejected.
Methods to recover HP:
Reaching a Statue of the Seven or a Teleport Waypoint
Triggering Everflame Seed

By holding Elemental Burst, when the player tries to leave Natlan or after the Saurian is defeated, the player will be ejected from the Indwelt State. During a manual ejection, it will leave a Spiritsconce specific to the Indwelt Saurian on the ground.
During the Indwelt State, players will be able to interact with Saurians and activate special dialogues, but it is not possible to talk to humans. Interacting with Statues of the Seven, Tablet of Tona, or cooking is also not possible.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Phlogiston</color>

Phlogiston is a special high-temperature energy that can be found throughout Natlan. The energy is necessary to be able to use Saurian abilities.
During the Indwelt State, there will be a Phlogiston bar unique to the Saurian, and it will be prioritized over the player's reserves.
Methods to recover Phlogiston:
Reaching a Statue of the Seven or a Teleport Waypoint
Triggering Everflame Seed
Interacting with a Flaming Seed, a Molten Fissure, Gaseous Phlogiston, a Ring of Speed, or an Ancient Glazeback Turtle
Collecting Candlecap Mushrooms, Crystal Beetles, Pyro Crystalflies, Embercore Flowers, or Phlogiston Aphids
Destroying Phlogiston objects like Phlogiston Piles, Phlogiston Explosive Barrels, Flamegranates, Unstable Phlogiston Crystals, Recon Targets, Pulverite, Hot Phlogiston Balloons.
Tutorial:
Indwelt State Abilities
During the <color=#ffe14b>Indwelt State</color> , the player's abilities will be switched with the specific Saurian's abilities.
Tepetlisaurus

<color=#ffffff>Normal Attack</color> : Attack with its torso, dealing <color=#ffe699>Geo DMG</color> .
<color=#ffffff>Elemental Skill</color> : Burrow into the ground.
<color=#ffd780>Drilling State</color>
It is a special state for Tepetlisaurs, and its abilities will change again. It will continuously consume Phlogiston to maintain this state.
<color=#ffffff>Normal Attack</color> : Create a shockwave on the ground. It will deal <color=#ffe699>Geo DMG</color> and apply <color=#ffe699>Geo</color> to the enemy.
<color=#ffffff>Elemental Skill</color> : Exit the state.
<color=#ffffff>Jump</color> : Trigger a short high-speed leap forward.
<color=#ffffff>Jump, while falling</color> : Trigger a longer distance leap forward.
<color=#ffd780>Other Abilities</color>
Can climb <color=#ffe14b>Solid Phlogiston</color> .
Tutorial:
Koholasaurus

<color=#ffffff>Normal Attack</color> : Drill forward. It will deal <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> and apply <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> to the enemy.
<color=#ffffff>Jump, while in water</color> : Perform a short jump.
<color=#ffffff>Elemental Skill, while moving in water</color> : Consume <color=#ffffff73>Phlogiston</color> to perform a dash.
<color=#ffffff>Hold Elemental Skill, while moving in water</color> : Consume <color=#ffffff73>Phlogiston a</color> nd enter the Aquadash State.
<color=#ffd780>Aquadash State</color>
It is a special state for Koholasaurs and some of its abilities will change. It will continuously consume Phlogiston to maintain this state.
<color=#ffffff>Jump</color> : Perform a long distance high-speed leap forward.
<color=#ffd780>Other Abilities</color>
Can swim in <color=#ffe14b>Liquid Phlogiston</color> .
Tutorial:
Yumkasaurus

<color=#ffffff>1st Normal Attack</color> : Perform a kick. It will deal <color=#99ff88>Dendro DMG</color> and apply <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> to the enemy.
<color=#ffffff>2nd Normal Attack</color> : Push with its legs. It will deal <color=#99ff88>Dendro DMG</color> and apply <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> to the enemy.
<color=#ffffff>Normal Attack/Jump, while in the air or falling down</color> <color=#ffffff73>:</color> Perform an air kick.
<color=#ffffff>Elemental Skill</color> : Spit out its <color=#ffe14b>Flamegranate Pectin</color> and move forward.
<color=#ffffff>Hold Elemental Skill</color> : Aim <color=#ffe14b>Flamegranate Pectin</color> in any direction. The player can also move freely for a few seconds before the ability is canceled and goes into cooldown.
<color=#ffffff>Elemental Skill, after first use and while in the air</color> : The Elemental Skill is modified, and using it will consume Phlogiston. The Elemental Skill will then be made unavailable until it lands on the ground.
<color=#ffffff>Modified Elemental Skill</color> : Leap forward in the air again.
<color=#ffffff>Hold Modified Elemental Skill</color> : Hover in the air, change the direction, and leap forward.
<color=#ffd780>Other Abilities</color>
<color=#ffe14b>Coilgrass Sigil</color> : When facing them, the Elemental Skill is modified. Use it to grapple and leap to the Coilgrass Sigil.
<color=#ffe14b>Flamegranate</color> <color=#ffffff73>or</color> <color=#ffe14b>Phlogiston Explosive Barrels</color> : When facing them, the Elemental Skill is modified. Use it to grab them. The Elemental Skill will be modified again, allowing to hurl them in any direction and cause explosions. This action will continuously consume Phlogiston until they're hurled.
Tutorial:
Qucusaurus

<color=#ffffff>Normal Attack</color> : Attacks with its claws forward. It will deal <color=#ff9999>Pyro DMG</color> and apply <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> to the enemy.
<color=#ffffff>Jump</color> : Performs a small jump. When a certain distance away from the ground or by a cliff, Qucusaurus takes to the air and glide. When altitude is insufficient, it will take flight after tapping Jump again and consuming Phlogiston.
<color=#ffd780>Gliding state</color>
It is a special state for Qucusaurus, and some of its abilities will change.
<color=#ffffff>Normal Attack</color> : Tap to perform a rolling dash, dealing <color=#ff9999>Pyro DMG</color> . Hold to launch a Plunging Attack, which can be canceled mid-duration by releasing, returning to the gliding state. If the Plunging Attack lands, it can cause a Phlogiston Current.
<color=#ffffff>Jump</color> : Make the Saurian slowly ascend consuming Phlogiston.
<color=#ffffff>Dash</color> : Consume Phlogiston to accelerate Qucusaurus glide in any direction.
<color=#ffd780>Other Abilities</color>
<color=#ffe14b>Gaseous Phlogiston</color> and <color=#ffe14b>Scorchwind Conflux</color> : Qucusaurs can take ascend in Gaseous Phlogiston without getting burned. They can also pick up some Gaseous Phlogiston Lumps. Using their power or ascending in Gaseous Phlogiston, Qucusaurs can maintain a state of having full Phlogiston and not consuming any. Using a Plunging Attack while in this state can even result in the creation of a short-lived Phlogiston Current.
<color=#ffe14b>Phlogiston Wind Tunnel</color> : Only Qucusaurs can enter this one-way path formed by gaseous Phlogiston eroding rocks, and swiftly reach the exit on the other end.
Tutorial:
Iktomisaurus

<color=#ffffff>Normal Attack</color> : Fires a projectile. It will deal <color=#99ffff>Cryo DMG</color> and apply <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> to the enemy.
<color=#ffffff>Jump</color> : Performs a small jump. Hold consuming Phlogiston to perform a higher leap. Absorbing Phlogiston from objects within their field of vision, if the Iktomisaurus is surrounded by a blue ring, the jump will be even higher.
<color=#ffffff>Hold to Aim</color> : Enters Spiritspeaker state.
<color=#ffd780>Spiritspeaker state</color>
It is a special state for Iktomisaurus, and new abilities are added.
<color=#ffffff>While Aiming</color> : They can absorb Phlogiston from objects and the information and power within Nightspirit Sigils and Nightspirit Graffiti, becoming able to create a corresponding Nightspirit Body.
<color=#ffffff>Elemental Skill</color> : Place the Nightspirit Body scanned from a Nightspirit Graffiti in front of the Iktomisaurus. Hold to aim the placement. Can be used while in the air too by consuming Phlogiston.
<color=#ffd780>Other Abilities</color>
<color=#ffe14b>Special Elemental Sight</color> : Iktomisaurs can detect special mechanisms using a unique form of Elemental Sight.
Tutorial:
Tatankasaurus

<color=#ffffff>Normal Attack</color> : Downward stomp that deals <color=#ffacff>AoE Electro DMG</color> and applies <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> to the enemy.
<color=#ffffff>Jump</color> : Performs a small leap.
<color=#ffffff>Elemental Skill</color> : Throws forward a blow with its head, dealing <color=#ffacff>Electro DMG</color> . Then it enters the Spirited state.
<color=#ffffff>Dash</color> : Sprints forward and perform a Quick Charge consuming Phlogiston. When a charging Tatankasaurus hits an obstacle and is obstructed, it will enter the Spirited state.
<color=#ffffff>Plunging Attack</color> : Throws itself headfirst and deals <color=#ffacff>AoE Electro DMG</color> .
<color=#ffd780>Spirited state</color>
It is a special state for Tatankasaurus, and some of its abilities will change.
<color=#ffffff>Dash</color> : The Tatankasaurus has 3 s (displayed above its head) to activate the special Dash of the Spirited state. While dashing in this state, it will consume Phlogiston to run faster and make flying leaps using terrain, push heavy objects, break through Pulverite, knock Matador Monetoo down, and even briefly dash across water or liquid Phlogiston without taking damage.
<color=#ffd780>Other Abilities</color>
<color=#ffe14b>Ring of Speed</color> : They will be stimulated by the energy within, causing them to enter a second sprint.
<color=#ffe14b>The Twisted Dark Mud</color> : Tatankasaurs are capable of resisting the continuous loss of HP and mobility.
<color=#ffe14b>Oozing Core</color> , <color=#ffe14b>Matador Monetoo</color> , and <color=#ffe14b>Secret Source Dragon... Cannon?</color> : With their powerful charges, they can significantly affect Oozing Cores, knock Matador Monetoo down while waving their flags and standing atop rocks, and break those dragon statue mechanism parts that fire projectiles.
<color=#ffe14b>Geothermal Vent</color> : Tatankasaurus's downward stomp can cause it to collapse, causing other strange phenomena to occur nearby.
Tutorial:

Natlanese characters can interact with mechanisms that require the abilities of specific Saurian via <color=#ffe14b>Indwelt State</color> corresponding to their tribe. This gameplay mechanism is called " <color=#ffffff73>Mimesis</color> ."
Natlanese characters can use their Elemental Skill to enter the <color=#ffe14b>Nightsoul's Blessing State</color> to perform Mimesis gameplay, and their special <color=#ffe14b>Talent Passive: Night Realm's Gift</color> will further enhance these abilities.
Tepetlisaurus
Characters from the <color=#ece5d8>Children of Echoes</color> can mimic the abilities of

customize.name: Tepetlisaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with a drill-like horn and strong claws that can tunnel through rocks and solid phlogiston.
According to legend, the ancestor of all Tepetlisaurs was a massive drake as large as a mountain, with an exceptionally long lifespan. When it slept, mountains would form along its back, and when it woke, it would shake off the dirt and rocks, leaving behind gems and jade shining amongst its scales. The huge, drill-shaped objects in the Children of Echoes are said to be the remains of that great drake's large drill-horn.

customize.name: Kachina
customize.desc: A young warrior of the Nanatzcayan, given the Ancient Name of "Uthabiti." Kind-hearted and insatiably persistent, she grows stronger and more capable with each setback she faces.

customize.name: Xilonen
customize.desc: A Name Engraver of the Nanatzcayan, she is especially skilled at finding a good balance between the heavy responsibilities of her job and living well.

customize.text:
They can use <color=#ffe14b>Molten Fissures</color> and climb <color=#ffe14b>Solid Phlogiston</color> while in their <color=#ffffff73>Nightsoul's Blessing State.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Kachina</color> - She can climb onto her <color=#ffe699>Turbo Twirly</color> to control it and move on Solid Phlogiston.
<color=#ffffff>Xilonen</color> - She can use her <color=#ffe699>Blade Roller</color> to move on Solid Phlogiston.
<color=#ffffff>Mavuika</color> - She can ride her <color=#ff9999>Flamestrider</color> to move on Solid Phlogiston.
They can sense the presence of buried things and unbury them while in their <color=#ffffff73>Nightsoul's Blessing State.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Kachina</color> - Use Normal Attack to slam the ground with <color=#ffe699>Turbo Twirly</color> to create shockwaves.
<color=#ffffff>Xilonen</color> - Use Normal Attack to kick with her <color=#ffe699>Blade Roller</color> .
<color=#ffd780>Night Realm's Gift buff</color>
<color=#ffffff>Kachina</color> - Stamina consumption is reduced by 90% when climbing while riding <color=#ffe699>Turbo Twirly</color> in <color=#ece5d8>Natlan</color> .
<color=#ffffff>Xilonen</color> - No Stamina consumption when climbing while in the Nightsoul's Blessing State in <color=#ece5d8>Natlan</color> .
Koholasaurus
Characters from the <color=#ece5d8>People of the Springs</color> can mimic the abilities of

customize.name: Koholasaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with thick, strong flippers and a long tail that can swim in water and liquid phlogiston.
According to legend, more ancient dragons were even more able to adapt to their environments, and when the largest dragon in the ocean of the age floated on the surface, it could even be mistaken for an island. It is said that today's Koholasaurus are the descendants of that great sea dragon, and in their broad backs the colossal forms of those ancient sea beasts may yet be glimpsed.

customize.name: Mualani
customize.desc: A well-known guide in Natlan who owns a watersports shop, and expert in all forms of wave-chasing.

customize.text:
They can freely move on the water surface, <color=#ffe14b>Liquid Phlogiston</color> , and <color=#ffe14b>Spiritways</color> with their abilities while in their Nightsoul's Blessing state.
<color=#ffffff>Mualani</color> - She can surf using her <color=#80c0ff>Sharky Surfboard</color> .
<color=#ffffff>Mavuika</color> - She can surf riding her <color=#ff9999>Flamestrider</color> .
They are immune to the damage from <color=#ffe14b>Liquid Phlogiston</color> while in their Nightsoul's Blessing state.
<color=#ffd780>Night Realm's Gift buff</color>
<color=#ffffff>Mualani</color> - Nightsoul point and Phlogiston consumption while moving on water and <color=#ffe14b>Liquid Phlogiston</color> during Nightsoul's Blessing state is reduced by 75% in <color=#ffffff>Natlan</color> and 35% outside <color=#ece5d8>Natlan</color> .
Yumkasaurus
Characters from the <color=#ece5d8>Scions of the Canopy</color> can mimic the abilities of

customize.name: Yumkasaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with powerful hind legs and a fluffy tail, capable of spitting Flamegranate pectin hidden in their cheek pouches out, wrapping around distant objects.
According to legend, the original Yumkasaurs were not at all like today, but much smaller, so small that they were difficult even to see. They could roam freely with the wind, cling to the bodies of the massive dragons, or gather in groups to move about like clouds. However, in order to maintain their form after their abilities degenerated, they had no choice but to assume their current shape.

customize.name: Kinich
customize.desc: A Huitztlan Saurian Hunter skilled at counting costs.

customize.text:
They can use the grappling hook to aim in any direction and leap forward in their Nightsoul’s Blessing state. While in the air after using the ability, they can use it again to hover in the air and leap in any direction.
They can use any item Yumkasaurs can interact with in their Nightsoul’s Blessing state. While in this state, their interactions with the items will follow rules applicable to Yumkasaurs.
<color=#ffd780>Night Realm's Gift buff</color>
<color=#ffffff>Kinich</color> - In Nightsoul's Blessing State, when interacting with items Yumkasaurs can interact with, enter "Yumkasaur Mimesis" state. While in this state, Nightsoul's Blessing State will not be put on CD.
Qucusaurus
Characters from the <color=#ece5d8>Flower-Feather Clan</color> can mimic the abilities of

customize.name: Qucusaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with large, supple wings that can glide through the air for long periods.
It is said that the ancestors of the Qucusaurs were the closest in form to the mighty winged dragons, and that they could soar through the sky like clouds. According to the storytellers, when the greatest of such dragons spread its wings, the entire sky would be blotted out. Of course, the Qucusaurs we see today no longer possess such forms, but the claws they hide within their downy feather coats remain as sharp as ever.

customize.name: Chasca
customize.desc: The Peacemaker of the Tlalocan, the ender of all disputes.

customize.text:
They can continuously consume Phlogiston to remain airborne.
<color=#ffffff>Chasca</color> - She can fly, mounting her " <color=#80ffd7>Soulsniper: Ritual Staff</color> ."
<color=#ffffff>Mavuika</color> - She can fly riding her <color=#ff9999>Flamestrider</color> .
They can enter Phlogiston Wind Tunnel and stay in Gaseous Phlogiston without being burned <color=#ffffff73>.</color>
<color=#ffd780>Night Realm's Gift buff</color>
<color=#ffffff>Chasca</color> - She can use Nightsoul Transmission to enter in Nightsoul's Blessing state and gain 32 Nightsoul points.
Iktomisaurus
Characters from the <color=#ece5d8>Masters of the Night-Wind</color> can mimic the abilities of

customize.name: Iktomisaurus
customize.desc:
Able to use their plumage for leaping, Iktomisaurs are also the only type of Saurian to have grasped how to enter the "Spiritspeaker" state.
According to legend, their ancestors did not have a physical form, and instead could drift like spirits between reality and the spiritual realm, manifesting themselves through the darkness of night. Some also say that the first Iktomisaur to emerge from the Night Kingdom was not actually a true Saurian, but rather a unique race distinct from ordinary Saurians.

customize.name: Citlali
customize.desc: The great shaman from the Masters of the Night-Wind, the universally-revered Granny Itztli.

customize.name: Ororon
customize.desc: A young man from the Masters of the Night-Wind who instead lives in the wild alongside all manner of life.

customize.text:
They can perform high leaps by holding the jump button and consuming Phlogiston in Natlan, or Stamina.
They can enter Spiritspeaker state by Holding Aiming Mode and use the Iktomisaurus special Elemental Sight.
<color=#ffd780>Night Realm's Gift buff</color>
<color=#ffffff>Citlali</color> - She can use Nightsoul Transmission to perform a high leap without consuming Phlogiston and Stamina.
<color=#ffffff>Ororon</color> - He can use Nightsoul Transmission to perform a high leap without consuming Phlogiston and Stamina.
Tatankasaurus
Characters from the <color=#ece5d8>Collective of Plenty</color> can mimic the abilities of

customize.name: Tatankasaurus
customize.desc:
A saurian with a hard, bony crest and a powerful body suited to dashing around volcanic landscapes.
According to legend, the Tatankasaurus's ancestors were so large they could use their horns to move mountains, but they lacked the agility of their smaller, modern relatives. Perhaps the great power that Tatankasaurs still possess is a gift passed down through their bloodline.

customize.name: Varesa
customize.desc: A laid-back orchard manager and warrior of the Collective of Plenty. An aspiring hero who hungers for justice... and lots and lots of food!

customize.name: Iansan
customize.desc: Head coach of the fitness club at the Collective of Plenty, and a renowned Natlanese nutritionist.

customize.text:
They can enter the Spirited state while in Nightsoul's Blessing state.
In this state, their Movement SPD is increased, and they can make flying leaps using terrain, push heavy objects, break through Pulverite, knock Matador Monetoo down, or consume additional Nightsoul points to move on water or liquid Phlogiston while being immune to DMG from the latter.
<color=#ffd780>Night Realm's Gift buff</color>
<color=#ffffff>Varesa</color> - She won't take fall DMG when using terrain differences to make leaps in <color=#ffffff>Natlan</color> .
<color=#ffffff>Iansan</color> - She won't take fall DMG when using terrain differences to make leaps in <color=#ffffff>Natlan</color> .
Tepetlisaurs related Mechanisms
These mechanisms can be interacted with during the <color=#ffe14b>Indwelt State</color> as a

customize.name: Tepetlisaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with a drill-like horn and strong claws that can tunnel through rocks and solid phlogiston.
According to legend, the ancestor of all Tepetlisaurs was a massive drake as large as a mountain, with an exceptionally long lifespan. When it slept, mountains would form along its back, and when it woke, it would shake off the dirt and rocks, leaving behind gems and jade shining amongst its scales. The huge, drill-shaped objects in the Children of Echoes are said to be the remains of that great drake's large drill-horn.

customize.text: or the <color=#ffe14b>Nightsoul's Blessing State</color> of a character from the <color=#ece5d8>Children of Echoes</color> .
Exploration Mechanisms

<color=#ffffff>Mechanism</color>
<color=#ffffff>Details</color>
<color=#ffffff>Molten Fissure</color>

Interact with the mechanism to quickly travel a long distance without consuming Phlogiston or Stamina.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Buried Treasures</color>

Detect buried treasures and attack to unearth them.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Unstable Phlogiston Crystals</color>

Detect these Crystals hidden deep underground. They will explode if someone gets close to them.
<color=#ffffff73>Related Challenges:</color>
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>The Twisted Dark Mud</color>

Tepetlisaurs can resist the continuous loss of HP and mobility of this mud while digging.
Tutorial:
Combat Mechanisms

<color=#ffffff>Enemy</color>
<color=#ffffff>Mechanism</color>
<color=#ffffff>Secret Source Automaton: Configuration Device</color>

customize.name: Secret Source Automaton: Configuration Device
customize.desc:
A manufacturing machine from the ancient ruins. This type of machine, which can transform into numerous shapes, was used by the masters of the ancient ruins to perform various manufacturing tasks. As long as you learn how to use such a machine, you could build a city colossal beyond imagination, even within extreme environments like the depths of a volcano.
In addition, it also seems to be able to be used as a weapon. Though the ancient civilization has long since fallen, this machine, shaped like a giant claw and powered by the golden designs engraved on it, can still engage in battle based upon its preset instructions.

customize.text: When its Adaptive Countermeasures gauge is complete, it will summon 2 <color=#ffe14b>Solid Phlogiston</color> with <color=#ffffff>Accretion Mechanisms</color> on top. To interrupt this attack, the player must destroy the <color=#ffffff>Accretion Mechanisms</color> .
Koholasaurs related Mechanisms
These mechanisms can be interacted with during the <color=#ffe14b>Indwelt State</color> as a

customize.name: Koholasaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with thick, strong flippers and a long tail that can swim in water and liquid phlogiston.
According to legend, more ancient dragons were even more able to adapt to their environments, and when the largest dragon in the ocean of the age floated on the surface, it could even be mistaken for an island. It is said that today's Koholasaurus are the descendants of that great sea dragon, and in their broad backs the colossal forms of those ancient sea beasts may yet be glimpsed.

customize.text: or the <color=#ffe14b>Nightsoul's Blessing State</color> of a character from the <color=#ece5d8>People of the Springs</color> .
Exploration Mechanisms

<color=#ffffff>Mechanism</color>
<color=#ffffff>Details</color>
<color=#ffffff>Spiritways and Spiritdoors</color>

<color=#ffe14b>Spritways</color> can be used to travel or complete challenges, while <color=#ffe14b>Spiritdoors</color> can create or manifest them.
<color=#ffffff73>Related Challenges:</color>
Tutorials:
<color=#ffffff>Jet-Set Eddies</color>

Can be used to make a super high jump.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Phlogiston Engravings and Unveiling Scripts</color>

Koholasaurs' Aquadash or People of the Springs' Sprint is needed to power off the Scripts.
Tutorial:
Yumkasaurs related Mechanisms
These mechanisms can be interacted with during the <color=#ffe14b>Indwelt State</color> as a

customize.name: Yumkasaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with powerful hind legs and a fluffy tail, capable of spitting Flamegranate pectin hidden in their cheek pouches out, wrapping around distant objects.
According to legend, the original Yumkasaurs were not at all like today, but much smaller, so small that they were difficult even to see. They could roam freely with the wind, cling to the bodies of the massive dragons, or gather in groups to move about like clouds. However, in order to maintain their form after their abilities degenerated, they had no choice but to assume their current shape.

customize.text: or the <color=#ffe14b>Nightsoul's Blessing State</color> of a character from the <color=#ece5d8>Scions of the Canopy</color> .
Exploration Mechanisms

<color=#ffffff>Mechanism</color>
<color=#ffffff>Details</color>
<color=#ffffff>Relay balls</color>

Can be grabbed and fired towards a platform of the specific color to activate it.
They can be thrown into Ball Path Converters to change the ball's direction and color.
After being used, Replica Relay Balls will reappear in their metal platforms, thus they can be used again.
Tutorials:
<color=#ffffff>Removable grappling hooks</color>

Can be grabbed onto and removed from its original location in order to be used elsewhere to activate mechanisms.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Cracked rocks</color>

Flamegranates can be hurled at cracked rocks to destroy them.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>All-purifying Sacred Flame</color>

Interact with braziers lit with Sacred Flame to obtain the protection of Sacred Flame. While in this state, Flamegranates can be used to cause explosions and scatter Abyss's power.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Coagulation Pearl</color>

Yumkasaurs can carry these pearls around, consuming Phlogiston. While held, liquid Phlogiston within a certain range will turn into solid Phlogiston.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Oozing Core</color>

These cores are significantly affected by Flamegranates' explosion.
Tutorial:
Combat Mechanisms

<color=#ffffff>Enemy</color>
<color=#ffffff>Mechanism</color>
<color=#ffffff>Gluttonous Yumkasaur Mountain King</color>

customize.name: Gluttonous Yumkasaur Mountain King
customize.desc:
A powerful Yumkasaur that has survived both the ravages of time and countless battles, surviving until the present day.
This "Mountain King," who once joined forces with the great heroes against the Black Tide, holds a special place in the hearts of the Scions of the Canopy. Some tribe members believe that it has its current body shape because it has a unique physique, like the Qucusaurus "Tyrant"... Though in fact, this is simply because it's lived for so long, and eaten way, WAY too much.

customize.text: Flamegranates released by it can be grabbed onto and hurled to deal <color=#ff9999>AoE Pyro DMG</color> and explode the others.
Qucusaurs related Mechanisms
These mechanisms can be interacted with during the <color=#ffe14b>Indwelt State</color> as a

customize.name: Qucusaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with large, supple wings that can glide through the air for long periods.
It is said that the ancestors of the Qucusaurs were the closest in form to the mighty winged dragons, and that they could soar through the sky like clouds. According to the storytellers, when the greatest of such dragons spread its wings, the entire sky would be blotted out. Of course, the Qucusaurs we see today no longer possess such forms, but the claws they hide within their downy feather coats remain as sharp as ever.

customize.text: or the <color=#ffe14b>Nightsoul's Blessing State</color> of a character from the <color=#ece5d8>Flower-Feather Clan</color> .
Exploration Mechanisms

<color=#ffffff>Mechanism</color>
<color=#ffffff>Details</color>
<color=#ffffff>Phlogiston Wind Tunnel</color>

Interact with the mechanism to swiftly reach the exit on the other end without consuming Phlogiston or Stamina.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Gaseous Phlogiston</color>

Qucusaurs can use the Wind Currents, and won't be burned by the high temperatures of the gaseous Phlogiston.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Scorchwind Conflux</color>

Interacting with Gaseous Phlogiston Lumps and Phlogiston Currents will cause a state of having full Phlogiston and not consuming any. A short-lived Phlogiston Current can be created by using a Plunging Attack while in this state.
Tutorial:
Iktomisaurs related Mechanisms
These mechanisms can be interacted with during the <color=#ffe14b>Indwelt State</color> as a

customize.name: Iktomisaurus
customize.desc:
Able to use their plumage for leaping, Iktomisaurs are also the only type of Saurian to have grasped how to enter the "Spiritspeaker" state.
According to legend, their ancestors did not have a physical form, and instead could drift like spirits between reality and the spiritual realm, manifesting themselves through the darkness of night. Some also say that the first Iktomisaur to emerge from the Night Kingdom was not actually a true Saurian, but rather a unique race distinct from ordinary Saurians.

customize.text: or the <color=#ffe14b>Nightsoul's Blessing State</color> of a character from the <color=#ece5d8>Masters of the Night-Wind</color> .
Exploration Mechanisms

<color=#ffffff>Mechanism</color>
<color=#ffffff>Details</color>
<color=#ffffff>Special Elemental Sight...</color>

Iktomisaurs detect special mechanisms using a unique form of Elemental Sight.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Nightspirit Graffiti and Nightspirit Bodies</color>

They can absorb the information and power from the Nightspirit Graffiti by Holding to Aim, and then create a corresponding Nightspirit Body.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Naughty Monetoo</color>

This Monetoo is calmed when touched by a Wind Current created through Nightspirit Graffiti.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>How to Jump Good...</color>

Iktomisaurs can leap up to high places, and enter the Spiritspeaker state by Holding to Aim, absorbing Phlogiston from objects within their field of view and further empowering their next jump.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>"Nightspirit Sigils"</color>

They can Hold to Aim and extract the information within these sigils to obtain rewards or strength.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Ancient Inscribed Rings...</color>

There is some special Phlogiston Engraving whose power within can be activated by Iktomisaurus Spiritspeaker state.
Tutorial:
Tatankasaurus related Mechanisms
These mechanisms can be interacted with during the <color=#ffe14b>Indwelt State</color> as a

customize.name: Tatankasaurus
customize.desc:
A saurian with a hard, bony crest and a powerful body suited to dashing around volcanic landscapes.
According to legend, the Tatankasaurus's ancestors were so large they could use their horns to move mountains, but they lacked the agility of their smaller, modern relatives. Perhaps the great power that Tatankasaurs still possess is a gift passed down through their bloodline.

customize.text: or the <color=#ffe14b>Nightsoul's Blessing State</color> of a character from the <color=#ece5d8>Collective of Plenty</color> .
Exploration Mechanisms

<color=#ffffff>Mechanism</color>
<color=#ffffff>Details</color>
<color=#ffffff>The Twisted Dark Mud</color>

Tatankasaurus can resist the continuous loss of HP and mobility of this mud.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Oozing Core</color>

These cores are significantly affected by Tatankasaurus's charge immense impact.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Matador Monetoo</color>

The Tatankasaurus's strongest charge in Spirited state can knock down this mischievous Monetoo.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Secret Source Dragon... Cannon?</color>

These dragon statue mechanism parts fire projectiles, but you can charge at the muzzle with immense power and strike a powerful blow to destroy it.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Ring of Speed</color>

When passing through it, the Tatankasaurus will enter a second sprint in Spirited state.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Pulverite</color>

Tatankasaurs can shatter these Phlogiston rocks with their attacks, and pass through them while in Spirited state.
Tutorial:
<color=#ffffff>Geothermal Vent</color>

Tatankasaurus's downward stomp can cause it to collapse, and then some other strange phenomena may occur nearby.
Tutorial:
Promotional Videos
Natlan Preview Teaser - Saurian Wanderings

<color=#ffd780>May 24, 2024</color>
Natlan is a nation where humans and Saurians live together.
You may have heard of this already, but seeing is believing.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Stop Motion Animation: "Natlan Tribe Introductions"

<color=#ffd780>August 17, 2024</color>
The warriors in the Stadium of the Sacred Flame are about to enter the fray.
While waiting for the competition to begin,
Why not take some time to listen to our three friends share the various facets of their tribal lives?
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Kachina's Notes: "Natlan's Saurian Companions"

<color=#ffd780>August 28, 2024</color>
You'll run into all kinds of Saurians during your adventures here in Natlan.
Journey alongside the Saurians and immerse yourself in the breathtaking vistas of Natlan.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Notices
"Children of Echoes"

<color=#ffd780>August 17, 2024</color>
Hello, Traveler!
Today, we'll be introducing the "Children of Echoes," one of Natlan's six tribes. Word has it that the mines near the tribes hide a lot of treasure!
People of the Springs

<color=#ffd780>August 18, 2024</color>
Hello, Traveler!
Do you enjoy soaking in hot springs? If so, don't miss out on the "People of the Springs"! They have the best vacation spot, so let's learn more about them!
"Scions of the Canopy"

<color=#ffd780>August 19, 2024</color>
Hello, Traveler!
I've heard that people from a certain tribe really love adventure and sometimes do things that seem quite dangerous to others. Let's learn more about them!
Natlan World Exploration Guide

<color=#ffd780>August 25, 2024</color>
Hello, Traveler!
The journey to Natlan is about to begin. Let's explore the interesting gameplay features in the new area together!
Adventure Guide | Search for the Mysterious and Legendary "Masters of the Night-Wind"...

<color=#ffd780>November 10, 2024</color>
Hello, Traveler~
Head west from the Stadium of the Sacred Flame and pass through the towering outer wall, there you will find a mysterious tribe — the Masters of the Night-Wind. Let us read this Adventure Guide and together remove the veil of secrecy that shrouds the Masters of the Night-Wind~
Learn to Fly With the Flower-Feather Clan!

<color=#ffd780>November 11, 2024</color>
Hello, Travelers!
In order to pursue the great dream in the morning mist and sea of clouds, the warriors who soared the skies never rested for a moment. Whether you're looking to explore the local culture and customs or just want to test out your flying skills, the Flower-Feather Clan is the place for you!
The Collective of Plenty Tour Group, off we go!

<color=#ffd780>March 17, 2025</color>
Hello, Traveler~
Welcome to the Collective of Plenty — a tribe nestled at the foot of a volcano, where strength is revered! Pack your bags and follow your temporary guide as we explore this bountiful land of farming and fecundity, and experience its unique culture and customs!
